item.title: 亚太经合组织峰会前夕，印度-太平洋地区贸易协议争夺战遭遇阻碍
item.description:
The United States is aiming to show that its key Asian economic initiative is making progress as Pacific Rim leaders gather in San Francisco next week, but significant holes remain on trade-related chapters, according to people familiar with the talks.翻译:据知情人士透露，随着环太平洋地区领导人下周齐聚旧金山，美国的目标是表明其关键的亚洲经济举措正在取得进展，但与贸易相关的章节仍存在重大漏洞。

Negotiators from 14 countries are racing to close out chapters of the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity in hastily arranged talks this week, with announcements expected on cooperation to accelerate the clean energy transition and to fight corruption and tax evasion.翻译:来自 14 个国家的谈判代表在本周仓促安排的会谈中竞相结束印太经济繁荣框架的各个章节，预计将宣布合作加速清洁能源转型以及打击腐败和逃税。

U.S. President Joe Biden is eager to portray IPEF as producing meaningful outcomes to leaders of Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation countries, as he seeks to offer them a U.S.-led alternative to deeper economic ties to China.翻译:美国总统乔·拜登渴望将IPEF描绘成对亚太经合组织国家领导人产生有意义的成果，因为他寻求为他们提供一个由美国主导的替代方案，以加深与中国的经济联系。

When the Biden administration launched the IPEF concept in October 2021, it made clear that the U.S.-hosted APEC summit was a key deadline, "and that has raised expectations," said Wendy Cutler, a former U.S. trade negotiator who now heads the Asia Society Policy Center in Washington.翻译:美国前贸易谈判代表、现任亚洲协会主席温迪·卡特勒 (Wendy Cutler) 表示，拜登政府于 2021 年 10 月推出 IPEF 概念时，明确表示美国主办的 APEC 峰会是一个关键的最后期限，“这提高了人们的预期”华盛顿政策中心。

"The importance of this is to show that the U.S. is stepping up, through APEC and IPEF, to say, 'We're back in Asia and we're going to remain a close economic partner,'" Cutler said.翻译:卡特勒表示：“此举的重要性在于表明美国正在通过 APEC 和 IPEF 站出来表明，‘我们回到了亚洲，我们将继续保持密切的经济伙伴关系。’”

Former President Donald Trump's administration abandoned the 12-country Trans-Pacific Partnership (TPP) free trade deal in 2017, but IPEF is far more limited in scope, foregoing traditional tariff reductions and other market-access improvements. Instead, it promised cooperation on supply chains and clean energy along with higher standards for labor, environment and regulatory practices and digital trade.翻译:前总统唐纳德·特朗普政府于 2017 年放弃了 12 个国家的跨太平洋伙伴关系 (TPP) 自由贸易协议，但 IPEF 的范围要有限得多，放弃了传统的关税削减和其他市场准入改进。相反，它承诺在供应链和清洁能源方面进行合作，以及提高劳工、环境和监管实践以及数字贸易的标准。

Countries participating in IPEF are Australia, Brunei, Fiji, India, Indonesia, Japan, Malaysia, New Zealand, the Philippines, Singapore, South Korea, Thailand, the United States and Vietnam. All but India and Fiji are also members of APEC.翻译:参加IPEF的国家有澳大利亚、文莱、斐济、印度、印度尼西亚、日本、马来西亚、新西兰、菲律宾、新加坡、韩国、泰国、美国和越南。除印度和斐济外，所有国家都是亚太经合组织成员。

Only one of the four IPEF "pillars," on strengthening supply chains, has a completed text, with deals reached in May on an early warning system for potential supply disruptions like those experienced after the pandemic, as well as a council to consult on supply chain issues such as those involving national security or critical economic sectors.翻译:IPEF 关于加强供应链的四个“支柱”中只有一个拥有完整的文本，并于 5 月份就潜在供应中断（如大流行后经历的情况）的预警系统达成了协议，并成立了一个供应磋商委员会涉及国家安全或关键经济部门的连锁问题。

People familiar with the talks said that two other pillars led by the Commerce Department are likely to reach substantial conclusion in the next week with announcements on boosting cooperation on de-carbonization efforts and to combat corruption and tax evasion.

DIGITAL SHIFT

The trade pillar has proven more difficult, with many countries not willing to meet U.S. demands to meet certain labor and environmental standards or needing more time to consider them, three people familiar with the talks said.翻译:三名知情人士表示，事实证明，贸易支柱更加困难，许多国家不愿意满足美国提出的某些劳工和环境标准的要求，或者需要更多时间来考虑这些标准。

Negotiations on digital trade standards - once seen as a marquee feature of the IPEF trade pillar - are largely frozen as the Biden administration has suspended discussions on key rules after reversing longstanding U.S. positions on e-commerce.翻译:数字贸易标准的谈判一度被视为 IPEF 贸易支柱的一个重要特征，但由于拜登政府在扭转了美国在电子商务方面的长期立场后暂停了对关键规则的讨论，因此基本上被冻结。

The U.S. Trade Representative's office last month dropped its insistence on rules to protect free cross-border data flows and to prohibit national requirements for data localization and reviews of software source code, arguing that the change was needed to give Congress room to enact stronger regulations on large technology firms. The move has pleased liberal Democrats who want to rein in Big Tech but angered many business groups.翻译:美国贸易代表办公室上个月放弃了对保护自由跨境数据流动和禁止数据本地化和软件源代码审查的国家要求的坚持，认为需要进行这一改变，以便国会有空间制定更严格的法规大型科技公司。此举让想要控制大型科技公司的自由派民主党人感到高兴，但也激怒了许多商业团体。

"It's tough. By adopting these fringe views on digital trade, USTR really brings the main substance on digital trade to a halt," said John Murphy, senior vice president for international policy for the U.S. Chamber of Commerce.翻译:美国商会负责国际政策的高级副总裁约翰·墨菲（John Murphy）表示：“这很艰难。通过对数字贸易采取这些边缘观点，美国贸易代表办公室实际上使数字贸易的主要内容陷入停滞。”

But the Biden administration remains determined to announce some agreements on the trade pillar, with the most likely deals seen in the area of trade facilitation measures, such as adoption of digital customs forms and electronic signature standards.翻译:但拜登政府仍然决心宣布一些关于贸易支柱的协议，最有可能达成的协议是贸易便利化措施领域，例如采用数字海关表格和电子签名标准。

One of the sources familiar with the talks said that early enthusiasm on the IPEF trade pillar - which excludes India - has given way to frustration over the difficulty and complexity of issues involved.翻译:一位熟悉谈判情况的消息人士表示，早期对 IPEF 贸易支柱（不包括印度）的热情已经被对所涉及问题的难度和复杂性的挫败感所取代。

"Trade negotiations take a long time, even when you're offering market access," said Cutler, who was USTR's lead negotiator on TPP a decade ago. "But when you're not offering market access, the onus is more on the demander - in this case, the United States - to show these other countries that there are benefits."翻译:十年前担任美国贸易代表办公室 TPP 首席谈判代表的卡特勒表示：“即使提供市场准入，贸易谈判也需要很长时间。” “但是，当你不提供市场准入时，需求者（在这种情况下是美国）就有更多的责任向其他国家表明存在好处。”

A group of moderate Democrats on Thursday urged Biden in a letter to strengthen IPEF but go a step further to turn it into a traditional market-opening trade agreement.翻译:周四，一群温和派民主党人在一封信中敦促拜登加强 IPEF，但更进一步将其转变为传统的市场开放贸易协议。

The New Democrat Coalition said, "We must pursue a more robust trade agenda in the critically important Indo-Pacific region and urge the Biden administration to finalize a deal that bolsters U.S. global leadership and meaningfully delivers for American workers, farmers and businesses."翻译:新民主党联盟表示，“我们必须在至关重要的印太地区推行更强有力的贸易议程，并敦促拜登政府敲定一项协议，以加强美国的全球领导地位，并为美国工人、农民和企业带来有意义的利益。”

Reporting by David Lawder; additional reporting by Trevor Hunnicutt; Editing by Sharon Singleton and Will Dunham翻译:大卫·劳德报道； Trevor Hunnicutt 的补充报道；莎朗·辛格尔顿和威尔·邓纳姆编辑

item.title: 德国默克公司表示半导体并购交易面临政治障碍
item.description:
German diversified group Merck KGaA (MRCG.DE), which last year said it was in the market for takeover deals worth as much as 20 billion euros ($21.4 billion), said on Thursday that any transaction to strengthen its semiconductor chemicals business would currently be challenging.翻译:德国多元化集团默克集团(MRCG.DE)去年表示正在市场上进行价值高达 200 亿欧元（214 亿美元）的收购交易，周四表示，任何旨在加强其半导体化学品业务的交易目前都将是具有挑战性的。

"The geopolitical hurdles of M&A in semiconductor are something to be mindful of," Merck's Chief Financial Officer Helene von Roeder said in a media call after the release of quarterly results.翻译:默克首席财务官 Helene von Roeder 在季度业绩发布后的媒体电话会议上表示：“半导体领域并购的地缘政治障碍值得关注。”

Overall, the company was taking an opportunistic and selective approach to deals, she added.翻译:她补充说，总体而言，该公司在交易中采取了机会主义和选择性的方式。

CEO Belen Garijo said in August that any deal could take a while and that acquisitions to strengthen Merck's Life Science unit, a supplier of gear and substances for the pharmaceutical industry, were a priority. Deals in drug development or semiconductor chemicals remained on the cards, the CEO said at the time.翻译:首席执行官贝伦·加里霍 (Belen Garijo) 在 8 月份表示，任何交易都可能需要一段时间，而优先事项是加强默克生命科学部门（制药行业设备和物质供应商）的收购。这位首席执行官当时表示，药物开发或半导体化学品方面的交易仍有可能。

($1 = 0.9344 euros)翻译:（1 美元 = 0.9344 欧元）

Reporting by Ludwig Burger, Editing by Linda Pasquini翻译:路德维希·伯格报道，琳达·帕斯奎尼编辑

item.title: 美国财政部长耶伦与中国国务院副总理何鸿燊将在亚太经合组织峰会前会面
item.description:
U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen will begin two days of meetings with Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng on Thursday in a bid to limit the economic fallout from tensions between Washington and Beijing and keep the lines of communication open on topics from national security to climate change.翻译:美国财政部长珍妮特·耶伦将于周四开始与中国国务院副总理何立峰举行为期两天的会议，以限制华盛顿和北京之间紧张局势造成的经济影响，并就国家安全和气候变化等话题保持沟通畅通。

U.S. Treasury officials have sought to downplay expectations for any breakthroughs from the meetings in San Francisco, where U.S. President Joe Biden next week will host a summit of Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) country leaders, including Chinese President Xi Jinping.翻译:美国财政部官员试图淡化对旧金山会议取得任何突破的预期，美国总统乔·拜登下周将在旧金山主持亚太经合组织（APEC）国家领导人峰会，其中包括中国国家主席习近平。

Biden and Xi are expected to steal the spotlight with a planned meeting on the summit sidelines. Yellen's second face-to-face meeting with He since she visited Beijing in July is among a series of cabinet-level engagements that paved the way for the two leaders to meet.翻译:预计拜登和习近平将在峰会间隙举行计划中的会晤，成为众人瞩目的焦点。耶伦自七月份访问北京以来与贺建奎的第二次面对面会面是一系列内阁级别的接触之一，为两位领导人的会面铺平了道路。

Yellen intends to reiterate her view that the U.S. and China cannot decouple and instead must pursue a "healthy competition" based on a level playing field and clear communications about their intentions regarding national security restrictions.翻译:耶伦打算重申她的观点，即美国和中国不能脱钩，而必须在公平竞争环境和就国家安全限制意图进行明确沟通的基础上追求“良性竞争”。

She said last week that the Biden administration would not choose a path of separation that would force Asian economies to choose between China and the U.S.翻译:她上周表示，拜登政府不会选择一条迫使亚洲经济体在中美之间做出选择的分裂道路。

Her San Francisco meetings will mark the first in-person gatherings of new U.S.-China economic and financial forums involving staff-level officials from both sides after their launch in October.翻译:她在旧金山的会议将标志着新的美中经济和金融论坛自十月启动以来首次有双方职员级官员参加。

But in announcing the consultations, Yellen said this would not be a recreation of the Obama administration's U.S.-China Strategic and Economic Dialogue, a broad forum that was widely criticized for its ineffectiveness.翻译:但耶伦在宣布磋商时表示，这不会是奥巴马政府美中战略与经济对话的重演，这一广泛的论坛因效率低下而受到广泛批评。

A U.S. Treasury official said that a key goal for the meetings was deepening communications with China, gaining a better understanding of the relationship, and avoiding any misunderstandings about U.S. policy decisions.

'FRACTURED' RELATIONSHIP

Kelly Ann Shaw, a former White House trade adviser to former President Donald Trump, said it was important for Yellen to re-engage with China, but that the meeting would do little to change the overall trajectory of U.S.-China relations.翻译:前总统唐纳德·特朗普的前白宫贸易顾问凯莉·安·肖表示，耶伦重新与中国接触很重要，但这次会议对改变美中关系的整体轨迹无济于事。

"This relationship is fundamentally fractured. And I think it's going to stay that way for the foreseeable future," said Shaw, a partner at law firm Hogan Lovells.翻译:霍金路伟律师事务所合伙人肖说：“这种关系从根本上破裂了。我认为在可预见的未来，这种关系仍将保持这种状态。”

"So it's about figuring out, what do we want this relationship to look like knowing that? And just because you don't like each other doesn't mean you can't get along where your interests align."翻译:“所以关键是弄清楚，知道这一点后，我们希望这种关系是什么样子？仅仅因为你们不喜欢对方，并不意味着你们不能在利益一致的情况下相处。”

Yellen said in an opinion piece published by the Washington Post on Monday that global challenges presented areas for potential U.S.-China cooperation, including climate change, debt relief for poor countries and the stemming of illicit financial flows to terrorism and illegal drugs.翻译:耶伦周一在《华盛顿邮报》发表的一篇评论文章中表示，全球挑战为中美之间潜在的合作领域提供了机会，包括气候变化、减免穷国债务以及阻止非法资金流向恐怖主义和非法毒品。

But Yellen also said she would raise U.S. objections to Chinese state subsidies and other economic policies.翻译:但耶伦还表示，她将提出美国对中国国家补贴和其他经济政策的反对意见。

"This week, I will speak to my counterpart about our serious concerns with Beijing's unfair economic practices, including its large-scale use of non-market tools, its barriers to market access, and its coercive actions against U.S. firms in China," Yellen wrote.翻译:耶伦表示：“本周，我将与我的同行谈论我们对北京不公平经济行为的严重关切，包括大规模使用非市场工具、市场准入壁垒以及对在华美国企业采取的强制行动。”写道。

The meetings are being held just days after the U.S. Treasury's semi-annual currency report chided China over a lack of transparency in its foreign exchange intervention practices. But the Treasury report said no major trading partners, including China, met the thresholds for currency manipulation.翻译:这些会议是在美国财政部半年度货币报告指责中国外汇干预行为缺乏透明度几天后举行的。但财政部报告称，包括中国在内的主要贸易伙伴均未达到货币操纵的门槛。

Reporting by David Lawder; Editing by Angus MacSwan and Paul Simao翻译:大卫·劳德报道；安格斯·麦克斯旺和保罗·西芒编辑

item.title: 科学家展示如何使月球土壤变得肥沃以用于农业
item.description:
If humankind is ever to establish long-term bases on the moon, there will be a need for a regular source of food. It is not practical, however, to think you can plant corn or wheat in plain lunar soil in greenhouses on the moon and expect a bumper crop - or any crop at all.翻译:如果人类要在月球上建立长期基地，就需要定期的食物来源。然而，认为可以在月球温室的普通月球土壤中种植玉米或小麦并期望获得丰收——或者根本没有任何作物——的想法是不切实际的。

But scientists are taking steps toward making moon agriculture a real possibility. Researchers said on Thursday they have found a way to turn inhospitable lunar soil fertile by introducing bacteria that enhance the availability of phosphorus, an important plant nutrient.翻译:但科学家们正在采取措施，使月球农业成为现实。研究人员周四表示，他们已经找到了一种方法，通过引入细菌来提高磷（一种重要的植物营养素）的利用率，从而使不适宜居住的月球土壤变得肥沃。

They performed experiments growing a relative of tobacco using simulated moon soil, more properly called lunar regolith, in a laboratory in China. They found that such soil treated with three species of bacteria produced plants with longer stems and roots as well as heavier and wider clusters of leaves compared to the same soil without the microbes.翻译:他们在中国的一个实验室中进行了利用模拟月球土壤（更准确地称为月球风化层）种植烟草近亲的实验。他们发现，与没有微生物的相同土壤相比，用三种细菌处理过的土壤产生的植物具有更长的茎和根以及更重和更宽的叶簇。

The action of the bacteria, the researchers said, made the soil more acidic. This resulting low pH environment caused insoluble phosphate-containing minerals to dissolve and release the phosphorus in them, increasing phosphorus availability for the plants.翻译:研究人员表示，细菌的作用使土壤变得更加酸性。由此产生的低pH环境导致不溶性含磷酸盐矿物质溶解并释放其中的磷，从而增加植物对磷的利用率。

"The importance of these findings is that we may be able to use these microbes to turn the lunar regolith into bio-friendly substrate for plant cultivation in future lunar greenhouses," said researcher Yitong Xia of the China Agricultural University in Beijing, lead author of the study published in the journal Communications Biology.翻译:“这些发现的重要性在于，我们也许能够利用这些微生物将月球风化层转化为生物友好的基质，用于未来月球温室中的植物栽培，”北京中国农业大学的研究员夏一桐说，他是该论文的第一作者。该研究发表在《通讯生物学》杂志上。

In a study published last year, researchers in the United States grew a flowering weed called Arabidopsis thaliana in 12 thimble-sized containers, each bearing a gram of actual moon soil collected during NASA missions more than a half century ago.翻译:在去年发表的一项研究中，美国研究人员在 12 个顶针大小的容器中种植了一种名为拟南芥的开花杂草，每个容器中装有半个多世纪前 NASA 任务期间收集的一克实际月球土壤。

Arabidopsis, also called thale cress, is a plant widely used in scientific research. In that study, Arabidopsis did grow, but not as robustly in the lunar soil as in volcanic ash from Earth used for comparative purposes, suggesting that lunar soil could use a little help to become more fertile.翻译:拟南芥，也称为拟南芥，是一种广泛用于科学研究的植物。在这项研究中，拟南芥确实在月球土壤中生长，但不如在用于比较目的的地球火山灰中生长得那么旺盛，这表明月球土壤需要一点帮助才能变得更加肥沃。

The new research involved benth, scientific name Nicotiana benthamiana, another plant often used in research.翻译:这项新研究涉及本斯（学名 Nicotiana Benthamiana），是另一种常用于研究的植物。

The study used simulated regolith rather than the real thing because genuine lunar soil, as one might imagine, is in short supply on Earth. The researchers used volcanic material from the Changbai mountains of China's Jilin Province to create soil with similar chemical and physical properties to lunar regolith.翻译:这项研究使用的是模拟风化层而不是真实的风化层，因为正如人们想象的那样，真正的月球土壤在地球上供不应求。研究人员利用来自中国吉林省长白山的火山物质创造了与月球风化层具有相似化学和物理特性的土壤。

The three bacteria used in the study were: Bacillus mucilaginosus, Bacillus megaterium and Pseudomonas fluorescens. The researchers tested other bacteria as well, but those did not produce the same beneficial effects.翻译:研究中使用的三种细菌是：粘液芽孢杆菌、巨大芽孢杆菌和荧光假单胞菌。研究人员还测试了其他细菌，但这些细菌并没有产生同样的有益效果。

"Considering the huge scientific and economic potential of the moon, we will need to set up manned lunar bases in the future. But how can we provide food, oxygen and water for the crew members? Of course we can carry them to the moon by rockets, but that is economically unsustainable. A greenhouse for plant cultivation on the moon could greatly reduce the need of Earth-moon transportation," Xia said.翻译:“考虑到月球巨大的科学和经济潜力，未来我们需要建立载人月球基地。但是我们如何为宇航员提供食物、氧气和水呢？我们当然可以通过“火箭，但这在经济上是不可持续的。在月球上建造植物种植温室可以大大减少地月运输的需求。”夏说。

A plant cultivation system on the moon could help meet long-term food and oxygen requirements for human crews, Xia added. Plants produce oxygen as a byproduct of photosynthesis, the biological process in which they turn sunlight into energy.翻译:夏补充说，月球上的植物栽培系统可以帮助满足人类宇航员的长期食物和氧气需求。植物产生的氧气是光合作用的副产品，光合作用是植物将阳光转化为能量的生物过程。

"We have several ways to grow plants on the moon, including transporting horticultural soil to the moon, building up a hydroponic system (growing plants without soil) or using soil substitute like hydrogels (gels whose liquid component is water). Those methods do not need lunar soil, but all of them would consume huge carrying capability on rockets, making these plans very expensive," Xia said.翻译:“我们有几种在月球上种植植物的方法，包括将园艺土壤运送到月球、建立水培系统（在没有土壤的情况下种植植物）或使用水凝胶（液体成分为水的凝胶）等土壤替代品。这些方法不需要月球土壤，但所有这些都会消耗火箭巨大的运载能力，使得这些计划非常昂贵，”夏说。

"In contrast, our technique, which is a kind of in-situ resource utilization, applies microbial improvement to the lunar soil, making it more fertile and capable for plant cultivation," Xia added. "Our study achieved the same goal with much less consumption of carrying capability comparing with other plans."翻译:“相比之下，我们的技术是一种原位资源利用，将微生物改良应用于月球土壤，使其更加肥沃，能够种植植物，”夏补充道。 “我们的研究达到了相同的目标，与其他计划相比，承载能力的消耗要少得多。”

Reporting by Will Dunham, Editing by Rosalba O'Brien翻译:威尔·邓纳姆报道，罗萨尔巴·奥布莱恩编辑

item.title: 美国立法者将公布法案要求私募股权公司披露中国投资
item.description:
Two U.S. senators plan to introduce a bipartisan bill on Thursday that would require private equity firms to make public how much they invest in China and other countries of concern.翻译:两名美国参议员计划于周四提出一项两党法案，要求私募股权公司公开其在中国和其他相关国家的投资金额。

The bill, set to be introduced by Democratic Senator Bob Casey and Republican Senator Rick Scott, is the latest effort to track U.S. investments in China.翻译:该法案将由民主党参议员鲍勃·凯西和共和党参议员里克·斯科特提出，是追踪美国在华投资的最新举措。

"The American people deserve to know where and how their savings are being invested," Casey said in a statement.翻译:凯西在一份声明中说：“美国人民应该知道他们的储蓄被投资到哪里以及如何投资。”

The United States has sought to crack down on U.S. investment in China over fears U.S. dollars and know-how are aiding Beijing's technological advances to modernize its military.翻译:由于担心美元和技术正在帮助北京实现军事现代化的技术进步，美国一直试图打击美国对华投资。

U.S. private investment firms have poured more than $80 billion into China between 2018 and 2022, some via pension plans, according to Casey's office.翻译:凯西办公室称，2018年至2022年间，美国私人投资公司已向中国注入超过800亿美元，其中一些是通过养老金计划。

The new congressional measure would require private equity funds to annually disclose assets invested in China, Iran, Russia and North Korea to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, which would then be required to make public a report based on the information.翻译:新的国会措施将要求私募股权基金每年向美国证券交易委员会披露在中国、伊朗、俄罗斯和朝鲜投资的资产，然后要求美国证券交易委员会根据这些信息公开一份报告。

It would also require disclosure of certain information about private security sales.翻译:它还要求披露有关私人证券销售的某些信息。

Rick Scott's office did not immediately respond to an emailed request for comment.翻译:里克·斯科特的办公室没有立即回复通过电子邮件发送的置评请求。

Casey has also co-sponsored a measure that would require government notification of investments in certain sensitive technology sectors in China. That measure has been added as an amendment to the Senate's National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) and may or may not survive reconciliation with the House's version.翻译:凯西还共同发起了一项措施，要求政府通报对中国某些敏感技术领域的投资。该措施已作为参议院国防授权法案 (NDAA) 的修正案添加，并且可能会也可能不会在与众议院版本协调后继续存在。

The new bill also comes in the wake of an executive order on outbound investment to prohibit some U.S. investments in China in semiconductors and microelectronics, quantum computing and artificial intelligence, and require notification of others. The order has not yet been implemented.翻译:这项新法案也是在一项关于对外投资的行政命令之后出台的，该命令禁止美国在中国对半导体和微电子、量子计算和人工智能的部分投资，并要求其他方面进行通报。该命令尚未执行。

Reporting by Karen Freifeld; Editing by Sharon Singleton翻译:凯伦·弗赖菲尔德报道；莎朗·辛格尔顿编辑

item.title: 大众汽车高管表示，大众汽车计划在 3-4 年内向美国推出 35,000 美元以下的电动汽车
item.description:
Volkswagen (VOWG_p.DE) aims to bring an under $35,000 electric vehicle to the U.S. market in 3-4 years, while Chinese automaker Nio said it is still "debating" a 2025 entry into North America, senior executives said on Thursday at a Reuters conference.翻译:大众汽车(VOWG_p.DE) 的高管周四在路透社表示，其目标是在 3-4 年内向美国市场推出售价低于 35,000 美元的电动汽车，而中国汽车制造商蔚来汽车表示，其仍在“讨论”2025 年进入北美市场的事宜。会议。

"We are not scaling back" plans for EVs in the U.S. market," said Reinhard Fischer, senior vice president and head of strategy at VW Group of America.翻译:美国大众集团高级副总裁兼战略主管莱因哈德·费舍尔表示：“我们不会缩减”美国市场电动汽车的计划。

"Things have changed" in terms of geopolitics, global supply chains and other factors affecting a decision to sell its cars in the U.S., said Ganesh Iyer, chief executive officer of Nio USA.翻译:蔚来美国首席执行官加内什·艾耶 (Ganesh Iyer) 表示，地缘政治、全球供应链和其他影响在美国销售汽车决定的因素“情况已经发生了变化”。

Speaking at the Reuters Events Automotive USA 2023 conference in Detroit, Fischer said VW plans to build the under-$35,000 EV in the United States or Mexico.翻译:费舍尔在底特律举行的路透社活动美国 2023 年汽车会议上发表讲话时表示，大众计划在美国或墨西哥生产售价低于 35,000 美元的电动汽车。

Options include VW plants in Chattanooga, Tennessee and Puebla, Mexico, as well as a new South Carolina assembly plant planned for VW subsidiary Scout.翻译:选项包括大众汽车在田纳西州查塔努加和墨西哥普埃布拉的工厂，以及计划为大众子公司 Scout 建造的南卡罗来纳州新装配厂。

VW also is looking at localizing assembly of battery packs for the under-$35,000 EV to qualify for additional incentives under the U.S. Inflation Reduction Act, Fischer said.翻译:Fischer 表示，大众汽车还正在考虑为 35,000 美元以下的电动汽车进行本地化电池组组装，以获得美国通货膨胀减少法案规定的额外激励措施。

The German automaker previously has announced plans to build battery cells in Canada for its current and future North American-built EVs.翻译:这家德国汽车制造商此前曾宣布计划在加拿大为其当前和未来在北美制造的电动汽车生产电池。

At the same conference, Iyer said Nio needs to build infrastructure before bringing electric vehicles to North America and that the company is considering "any kind of partnerships."翻译:在同一次会议上，艾耶表示，蔚来汽车需要在将电动汽车引入北美之前建设基础设施，并且该公司正在考虑“任何形式的合作伙伴关系”。

Reporting by Paul Lienert in Detroit; Editing by Mark Porter翻译:保罗·利纳特 (Paul Lienert) 底特律报道；马克·波特编辑 and Sharon Singleton翻译:保罗·利纳特 (Paul Lienert) 底特律报道；马克·波特和莎朗·辛格尔顿编辑

item.title: 独家：吉利旗下 Zeekr 距离美国 IPO 更近了一步，将于本周公开备案--消息人士
item.description:
Zeekr, Chinese automaker Geely's (GEELY.UL) premium electric car brand, will this week publicly release some details of its plans to list shares in New York, according to two sources with direct knowledge of the matter, seeking to ride growing enthusiasm for EVs despite strained U.S.-China ties.翻译:据两位直接了解情况的消息人士透露，中国汽车制造商吉利 (GEELY.UL) 旗下的高端电动汽车品牌 Zeekr 将于本周公开发布其在纽约上市计划的一些细节，以寻求利用人们对电动汽车日益高涨的热情。尽管美中关系紧张。

The EV brand will publish its prospectus and its shares could start being traded on the bourse within weeks of the announcement, the sources said.翻译:消息人士称，该电动汽车品牌将发布招股说明书，其股票可能会在公告发布后几周内开始在交易所交易。

Both sources declined to be identified discussing confidential information.翻译:两位消息人士在讨论机密信息时均拒绝透露姓名。

The underwriters are led by Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley, one source said, adding the size and price of the float will be decided later.翻译:一位消息人士称，承销商由高盛和摩根士丹利牵头，并补充说，发行规模和价格将在稍后决定。

Zeekr, Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs all declined comment.翻译:Zeekr、摩根士丹利和高盛均拒绝置评。

Zeekr confidentially filed for a U.S. initial public offering last December, aiming to raise more than $1 billion, Reuters has reported.翻译:据路透社报道，Zeekr 去年 12 月秘密申请在美国进行首次公开​​募股，旨在筹集超过 10 亿美元。

However, the company is likely to raise less than the targeted amount from the IPO, one of the sources said.翻译:然而，一位消息人士称，该公司通过 IPO 筹集的资金可能会低于目标金额。

A confidential filing allows companies to keep details from rivals longer and gives them added flexibility particularly when a timeline for an IPO is not fixed.翻译:保密文件允许公司更长时间地向竞争对手保留详细信息，并为他们提供更大的灵活性，特别是在首次公开募股的时间表不固定的情况下。

The IPO could mark the first major float by a Chinese company in the United States in two years since Beijing tightened its grip on overseas share sales in 2021 -- a shift triggered by a cybersecurity probe into ride-hailing giant Didi Global on the heels of its U.S. stock market debut.翻译:此次 IPO 可能标志着自北京在 2021 年收紧对海外股票销售的控制以来，两年来首家中国公司在美国上市——这一转变是继网约车巨头滴滴出行之后进行的网络安全调查引发的。其在美国股市首次亮相。

In February, Zeekr raised $750 million in a funding round that valued the brand at $13 billion from investors including Amnon Shashua, the CEO of autonomous driving technology company Mobileye Global (MBLY.O) - majority owned by Intel Corp (INTC.O) - and Chinese battery giant CATL (300750.SZ).翻译:今年 2 月，Zeekr 在一轮融资中筹集了 7.5 亿美元，该品牌估值达到 130 亿美元，投资方包括自动驾驶技术公司 Mobileye Global (MBLY.O)的首席执行官 Amnon Shashua，该公司的多数股权由英特尔公司(INTC.O)持有。以及中国电池巨头宁德时代（300750.SZ） 。

A price war started by Tesla (TSLA.O) in China at the beginning of the year is hitting the profitability of pure EV makers, which have stepped up efforts to prune costs and build partnerships to survive the consolidating competition.翻译:特斯拉(TSLA.O)年初在中国发起的价格战正在打击纯电动汽车制造商的盈利能力，这些制造商加大了削减成本和建立合作伙伴关系的力度，以在巩固的竞争中生存下来。

However, Zeekr, which is able to utilise Zhejiang Geely Holding Group's manufacturing facilities and cost-saving capabilities, has seen its profitability improve.翻译:然而，Zeekr能够利用浙江吉利控股集团的生产设施和成本节约能力，其盈利能力有所改善。

CEO Andy An told reporters in August that Zeekr achieved a double-digit gross profit in the first half of this year, compared to a 5% gross profit in 2022.翻译:首席执行官安迪·安（Andy An）8月份向记者表示，Zeekr今年上半年实现了两位数的毛利润，而2022年的毛利润为5%。

Zeekr, established in 2021, ranked 13th in EV sales in China among all brands with 79,028 units sold in the first nine months, more than double the same period in 2022.翻译:成立于2021年的Zeekr在中国电动汽车销量中排名第13位，前9个月销量为79,028辆，是2022年同期的两倍多。

It offers four EV models in China, with its 001 crossover priced from 269,000 yuan ($36,927.22) as its best-selling EV.翻译:该公司在中国提供四种电动车型，其中001跨界车的起售价为269,000元人民币（36,927.22美元），是其最畅销的电动汽车。

Zeekr has also announced plans to sell into overseas markets including the Netherlands, Sweden, Germany, Israel, Kazakhstan among others.翻译:Zeekr还宣布计划向荷兰、瑞典、德国、以色列、哈萨克斯坦等海外市场销售。

($1 = 7.2846 Chinese yuan renminbi)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.2846 人民币）

item.title: 经过本周的螺旋式下跌后，布伦特原油徘徊在 80 美元上方
item.description:
Summary:
  • Brent nearly $20 a barrel lower than September peak
  • Both Brent and WTI benchmarks hit lowest since July on Wednesday
  • OPEC to discuss 2024 output policy later this month
翻译:概括：
  • 布伦特原油价格比 9 月份峰值低近 20 美元/桶
  • 布伦特原油和 WTI 基准周三双双触及 7 月以来的最低点
  • OPEC将于本月晚些时候讨论2024年产量政策

The Brent crude oil benchmark hovered above $80 a barrel on Thursday, with demand concerns and a waning war-risk premium having triggered a selloff over the past week.翻译:布伦特原油基准周四徘徊在每桶 80 美元上方，需求担忧和战争风险溢价的减弱引发了过去一周的抛售。

Brent crude futures were up $1, or about 1.3%, at $80.54 a barrel by 1445 GMT. U.S. West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures rose $1.01, also about 1.3%, to $76.34.翻译:截至格林威治标准时间 1445 年，布伦特原油期货上涨 1 美元，至每桶 80.54 美元，涨幅约为 1.3%。美国西德克萨斯中质原油 (WTI) 原油期货上涨 1.01 美元，涨幅约为 1.3%，至 76.34 美元。

The uptick comes after both benchmarks dropped to their lowest since mid-July on Wednesday as worry over possible supply disruptions in the Middle East eased and concern over U.S. and Chinese demand intensified.翻译:周三，由于对中东可能出现供应中断的担忧有所缓解以及对美国和中国需求的担忧加剧，两项基准指数均跌至 7 月中旬以来的最低水平，之后价格出现上涨。

Brent is nearly $20 a barrel lower than its September peak.翻译:布伦特原油价格比 9 月份的峰值低近 20 美元/桶。

"It might be that this near-oversold status is causing a hiatus in selling this morning," said John Evans of oil broker PVM, adding that there was little positive news overnight and that the week's earlier losses reduced the impact of the latest Chinese data.翻译:石油经纪商 PVM 的约翰·埃文斯 (John Evans) 表示：“这种接近超卖的状态可能导致今天早上的抛售中断。”他补充说，隔夜几乎没有什么积极消息，而本周早些时候的下跌减少了中国最新数据的影响。

Thursday's data from China suggested that the fight against disinflation in the face of weak demand remains a challenge for the country's policymakers.翻译:周四来自中国的数据表明，在需求疲软的情况下对抗通货紧缩仍然是该国政策制定者面临的挑战。

Chinese consumer prices swung lower in October as key gauges of domestic demand pointed to weakness not seen since the pandemic while deepening factory-gate deflation cast doubts over the chances of a broad-based economic recovery.翻译:10月份中国消费者价格下跌，因为国内需求的关键指标显示出自大流行以来未见的疲软，而工厂门口通货紧缩的加深使人们对广泛的经济复苏的可能性产生了怀疑。

Earlier in the week customs data showed that China's total exports of goods and services contracted faster than expected.翻译:本周早些时候的海关数据显示，中国商品和服务出口总额收缩速度快于预期。

Demand indicators aren't looking rosy in the United States either. U.S. crude oil inventories increased by 11.9 million barrels over the week to Nov. 3, sources said, citing American Petroleum Institute figures.翻译:美国的需求指标看起来也不乐观。消息人士援引美国石油协会的数据称，截至 11 月 3 日当周，美国原油库存增加 1190 万桶。

If confirmed, this would represent the biggest weekly build since February. The U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA), however, has delayed release of weekly oil inventory data until Nov. 15 for a system upgrade.翻译:如果得到证实，这将是自二月份以来最大的单周涨幅。然而，由于系统升级，美国能源信息署 (EIA) 将每周石油库存数据推迟至 11 月 15 日发布。

On the bright side, global markets were upbeat on Thursday on the belief that major central banks are now done with rate hikes. High interest rates raise the cost of borrowing, dampening demand for everything, including oil.翻译:从好的方面来看，周四全球市场表现乐观，因为人们相信主要央行现已完成加息。高利率提高了借贷成本，抑制了包括石油在内的所有商品的需求。

Both OPEC and the International Energy Agency (IEA) are due to offer their view on the state of oil demand and supply fundamentals next week.翻译:欧佩克和国际能源署（IEA）将于下周就石油需求和供应基本面状况发表看法。

Since last month's reports, higher output is expected to emerge from Venezuela after relaxation of U.S. sanctions, said Callum Macpherson, head of commodities at Investec, also highlighting a deterioration in the demand outlook.翻译:天达集团大宗商品主管卡勒姆·麦克弗森(Callum Macpherson)表示，自上个月的报告以来，在美国放松制裁后，委内瑞拉的产量预计将增加，同时也强调了需求前景的恶化。

"There is a danger the market could be in a surplus next year even if the Saudis do extend their cuts beyond the end of December," he said.翻译:他表示：“即使沙特确实将减产期限延长到12月底之后，明年市场也可能出现盈余。”

OPEC is set to meet at the end of the month to discuss output policy for 2024.翻译:OPEC 定于本月底召开会议，讨论 2024 年产量政策。

Reporting by Natalie Grover in London, Andrew Hayley in Beijing and Jeslyn Lerh in Singapore Editing by David Goodman, Kirsten Donovan翻译:Natalie Grover 在伦敦、Andrew Hayley 在北京、Jeslyn Lerh 在新加坡报道编辑 David Goodman、Kirsten Donovan

item.title: 俄罗斯普京在哈萨克斯坦会谈小麦、化肥和物流
item.description:
Summary:
  • Commodities, energy top Putin's agenda on Kazakh trip
  • Putin seeking new commodity transport routes to the east
  • Kazakhstan wants to be logistics hub for Russian commodities
翻译:概括：
  • 大宗商品和能源是普京哈萨克斯坦之行的首要议程
  • 普京寻求通往东方的新商品运输路线
  • 哈萨克斯坦希望成为俄罗斯商品的物流中心

Russian President Vladimir Putin called for the development of wheat and fertiliser cargo transport routes in Asia during a visit to Kazakhstan on Thursday, as Moscow seeks to forge new export routes due to Western sanctions.翻译:俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京周四在访问哈萨克斯坦期间呼吁发展亚洲小麦和化肥货运路线，因为莫斯科因西方制裁而寻求建立新的出口路线。

Chairing a conference on agricultural cooperation with Kazakh President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev, Putin said Russia would have about 60 million metric tons of wheat available for exports from this year's strong crop.翻译:普京在与哈萨克斯坦总统托卡耶夫主持召开的农业合作会议上表示，俄罗斯今年的丰收将有约6000万吨小麦可供出口。

"We are confident, certainly, that we will retain the No.1 spot globally in terms of exports of this important commodity, wheat," Putin said.翻译:普京表示：“我们当然有信心，在小麦这一重要商品的出口方面，我们将保持全球第一的地位。”

He called for further development of shipping routes to large Asian markets such as China and India.翻译:他呼吁进一步开发通往中国和印度等亚洲大市场的航线。

Western sanctions on Russian banks and companies have made it more difficult for Russian exporters to ship grains and arrange payments, although the sanctions do not specifically target such commodities.翻译:西方对俄罗斯银行和公司的制裁使俄罗斯出口商运输谷物和安排付款变得更加困难，尽管制裁并未专门针对此类商品。

Moscow has also reportedly asked exporters to adopt a minimum wheat export price in order to protect farmers' income, though the functioning of the semi-official scheme is unclear.翻译:据报道，莫斯科还要求出口商采用最低小麦出口价格，以保护农民的收入，但半官方计划的运作情况尚不清楚。

Kazakhstan, in turn, is seeking to become a logistics hub for Russian commodities bound for China and Iran, officials say. The country already operates a railroad link between Russia and China and has a railroad connection with Iran along the Caspian.翻译:官员们表示，哈萨克斯坦正在寻求成为运往中国和伊朗的俄罗斯商品的物流中心。该国已经在俄罗斯和中国之间运营了一条铁路，并沿着里海与伊朗建立了铁路连接。

Thursday's visit was Putin's third known trip abroad since the Hague-based International Criminal Court (ICC) issued an arrest warrant in March for the Russian leader on war crime charges, something the Kremlin strongly rejects.翻译:周四的访问是自总部位于海牙的国际刑事法院（ICC）三月份以战争罪指控对俄罗斯领导人发出逮捕令以来普京第三次出访，但克里姆林宫强烈拒绝了这一指控。

Kazakhstan, like China and Kyrgyzstan, the two other countries Putin has visited recently, is not a signatory to the ICC.翻译:哈萨克斯坦与普京最近访问的另外两个国家中国和吉尔吉斯斯坦一样，都不是国际刑事法院的签署国。

The ICC, which accused Putin of illegally deporting children from Ukraine, obliges the court's 123 member states to arrest Putin and transfer him to The Hague for trial if he sets foot on their territory.

NEUTRALITY

Kazakhstan's Tokayev, a career diplomat, has carefully maintained neutrality in the Russia-West stand-off, and welcomed Putin just a week after hosting French President Emmanuel Macron. A United States delegation led by a senior State Department official visited Astana this week.翻译:哈萨克斯坦职业外交官托卡耶夫在俄罗斯与西方的对峙中谨慎地保持中立，并在接待法国总统埃马纽埃尔·马克龙一周后欢迎普京。由国务院高级官员率领的美国代表团本周访问了阿斯塔纳。

Kazakhstan has already taken advantage of the abundance of Russian natural gas which Europe has largely stopped buying. Together with Uzbekistan, it has started buying it for domestic needs while preparing to ramp up its own gas exports to China.翻译:哈萨克斯坦已经利用了俄罗斯丰富的天然气，而欧洲基本上已经停止购买这些天然气。它已与乌兹别克斯坦一起开始购买天然气以满足国内需求，同时准备增加对中国的天然气出口。

Some officials say it could adopt a similar strategy of "sanctions" arbitrage with wheat and other Russian exports.翻译:一些官员表示，它可能会采取类似的策略，对小麦和其他俄罗斯出口产品进行“制裁”套利。

After Thursday's talks, Putin and Tokayev said the volume of Russian gas supplies, currently agreed at 3 billion cubic metres a year each to Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan, could increase.翻译:周四会谈后，普京和托卡耶夫表示，俄罗斯目前向哈萨克斯坦和乌兹别克斯坦每年供应 30 亿立方米的天然气供应量可能会增加。

They also discussed Russian oil shipments to China, the potential construction of new pipelines, projects to build power plants in Kazakhstan, security cooperation and other issues, the two leaders said.翻译:两位领导人表示，他们还讨论了俄罗斯向中国的石油运输、可能建设的新管道、在哈萨克斯坦建设发电厂的项目、安全合作等问题。

item.title: 早盘竞价：石油和债券收益率试图找到立足点
item.description:
A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan翻译:迈克·多兰 (Mike Dolan) 对美国和全球市场未来一天的展望

With the more substantive of Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's two appearances this week still to come, markets have stalled as the week's surprising plunge in oil prices and bond yields levelled off.翻译:由于美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔本周还将有两次更实质性的露面，随着本周油价和债券收益率的意外暴跌趋于平稳，市场陷入停滞。

A fresh fall in China's consumer prices stoked deflationary fears there again and the global economic demand picture is starting to drag on commodity prices everywhere and is helping to defuse October's blistering spike in long-term borrowing rates.翻译:中国消费价格的新一轮下跌再次引发了通货紧缩的担忧，全球经济需求形势开始拖累各地大宗商品价格，并有助于缓解10月份长期借款利率的大幅飙升。

The supply picture for U.S. crude, which is now down more than 20% from late September's peaks, has also weighed on energy prices.翻译:美国原油供应情况目前较 9 月下旬的峰值下降了 20% 以上，这也给能源价格带来了压力。

Crude inventories increased by 11.9 million barrels over the week to Nov. 3, sources said, citing American Petroleum Institute figures. If confirmed, this would represent the biggest weekly build since February.翻译:消息人士援引美国石油协会的数据称，截至 11 月 3 日当周，原油库存增加了 1190 万桶。如果得到证实，这将是自二月份以来最大的单周涨幅。

With the energy price drop improving the inflation picture, it has helped drag 10-year Treasury yields back down to their lowest since Sept. 26 - hovering just above 4.5% early on Thursday despite a mixed reception for new 10-year notes auctioned yesterday. Some $24 billion of 30-year bonds are up for grabs later in the day.翻译:随着能源价格下跌改善通胀状况，10年期国债收益率回落至9月26日以来的最低水平——周四早些时候徘徊在4.5%上方，尽管昨天拍卖的新10年期国债反响不一。约 240 亿美元的 30 年期债券将于当天晚些时候发售。

With senior Fed officials on Wednesday side-stepping guidance on the central bank's next policy steps, attention focuses squarely on Powell's latest speech.翻译:由于周三美联储高级官员回避了对央行下一步政策步骤的指导，人们的注意力完全集中在鲍威尔的最新讲话上。

Critical in the speech will how Powell characterises the recent rollercoaster in bond yields and whether he protests in some way against market bets that the Fed will cut rates as soon as June.翻译:演讲中的关键在于鲍威尔如何描述最近债券收益率的过山车，以及他是否以某种方式抗议市场对美联储最早将于六月降息的押注。

It has left markets in a holding pattern first thing, with the S&P500 (.SPX) eking out an eighth straight gain to just under the 4,400 level on Wednesday and futures marginally up ahead of the open. The VIX (.VIX) recorded its lowest close since mid-September too and remains under 14.5 before today's bell.翻译:这首先让市场处于守势状态，周三标准普尔 500 指数(.SPX)连续第八次上涨，略低于 4,400 点，期货开盘前小幅上涨。 VIX (.VIX)也录得 9 月中旬以来的最低收盘价，在今天收盘前仍低于 14.5。

Overseas markets were firmer too, helped by some positive earnings readouts in Europe and a warning from Chinese authorities about speculative activity in domestic stocks there.翻译:受欧洲一些积极盈利数据以及中国当局对国内股市投机活动发出警告的推动，海外市场也走强。

In corporate news, the focus was on the entertainment industry.翻译:企业新闻中，焦点集中在娱乐业。

Hollywood actors reached a tentative agreement with major studios on Wednesday to resolve the second of two strikes that rocked the sector as writers and performers demanded higher pay in the streaming TV era.翻译:好莱坞演员周三与主要制片厂达成了一项临时协议，以解决因编剧和表演者在流媒体电视时代要求更高报酬而震动整个行业的两次罢工中的第二次。

Shares in Walt Disney (DIS.N) were up almost 4% overnight after it exceeded Wall Street's earnings expectations, with higher attendance at its Shanghai and Hong Kong theme parks offsetting a decline in advertising revenue at television network ABC.翻译:华特迪士尼(DIS.N)的股价一夜之间上涨近 4%，超出了华尔街的盈利预期，其上海和香港主题公园的游客人数增加抵消了电视网络 ABC 广告收入的下降。

But Warner Bros Discovery (WBD.O) plunged 19% on Wednesday after the media and entertainment conglomerate said the Hollywood strikes and a weak advertising market hurt its 2024 outlook.翻译:但华纳兄弟探索公司(WBD.O)周三暴跌 19%，此前这家媒体和娱乐集团表示，好莱坞罢工和疲软的广告市场损害了其 2024 年前景。

Key developments that should provide more direction to U.S. markets later on Thursday:翻译:周四晚些时候的关键事态发展将为美国市场提供更多方向：

* Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell speaks in Washington; Richmond Fed President Thomas Barkin, Atlanta Fed chief Raphael Bostic, St. Louis Interim Fed boss Kathleen O'Neill Paese all speak; European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde speaks in Brussels翻译:* 美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔在华盛顿发表讲话；里士满联储主席托马斯·巴尔金、亚特兰大联储主席拉斐尔·博斯蒂克、圣路易斯临时联储主席凯瑟琳·奥尼尔·佩斯均发表讲话；欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜·拉加德在布鲁塞尔发表讲话

* U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen opens two days of meetings with Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng翻译:* 美国财政部长珍妮特·耶伦与中国国务院副总理何立峰举行为期两天的会议

* U.S. weekly jobless claims翻译:* 美国每周申请失业救济人数

* U.S. corporate earnings: News Corp, Wynn Resorts, Tapestry, Westrock, Illumina, Hologic, Mettler-Toledo, TransDigm, Becton Dickinson,翻译:* 美国企业盈利：新闻集团、永利度假村、Tapestry、Westrock、Illumina、Hologic、梅特勒-托利多、TransDigm、Becton Dickinson、

* U.S. Treasury auctions $24 billion of 30-year bonds翻译:* 美国财政部拍卖240亿美元30年期债券

item.title: 中国敦促G7停止“煽动对抗”
item.description:
China expressed strong dissatisfaction with China-related comments made by G7 foreign ministers and urged the bloc to stop inciting confrontation, its embassy in Japan said in a statement on Thursday.翻译:中国驻日本大使馆周四发表声明称，中方对七国集团外长发表的涉华言论表示强烈不满，敦促七国集团停止煽动对抗。

A two-day G7 foreign minister meeting held in Tokyo ended on Wednesday and mainly called for humanitarian pauses in the Israel-Hamas war to allow in aid and help the release of hostages.翻译:周三在东京举行的为期两天的七国集团外长会议主要呼吁暂停以色列与哈马斯的战争，以允许援助并帮助释放人质。

In a joint statement, the G7 nations also urged China to address its non-market policies, not to assist Russia in its war against Ukraine, to keep the peace and stability across the Taiwan Strait, and to allow a high level of autonomy for Hong Kong.翻译:七国集团在联合声明中还敦促中国纠正非市场政策，不要协助俄罗斯对乌克兰发动战争，维护台海和平稳定，并允许香港高度自治。孔.

"China will resolutely counter any smear campaigns from external forces," the embassy said, adding it strongly protested against other countries' intentions to curb China with regards to Taiwan.翻译:使馆表示，中方将坚决反制外部势力的抹黑行为，对其他国家在台湾问题上遏制中国的企图表示强烈抗议。

President Tsai Ing-wen, of the democratically governed Taiwan island, said she would continue to work with G7 members toward a free and open Indo Pacific.翻译:民主统治的台湾岛的总统蔡英文表示，她将继续与七国集团成员合作，以实现自由开放的印度太平洋地区。

Critical comments on Taiwan and Hong Kong have long riled Beijing, which considers such criticism as outside interference in its domestic affairs.翻译:对台湾和香港的批评言论长期以来一直激怒北京，北京认为此类批评是外部势力干涉其内政。

Democratically governed Taiwan, which China considers as part of its territory, is the most sensitive issue. Taiwan rejects Beijing’s claim.翻译:中国认为民主统治的台湾是其领土的一部分，这是最敏感的问题。台湾拒绝北京的说法。

Some Western nations have also regularly reminded Beijing to better protect Hong Kong’s democratic principles, freedoms and autonomy, which they say have weakened after the implementation of a national security law in 2020.翻译:一些西方国家还经常提醒北京更好地保护香港的民主原则、自由和自治，他们称这些原则在2020年实施国家安全法后受到削弱。

Hong Kong returned from British to Chinese rule in 1997 with the guarantee its freedoms would be protected under a "one country, two systems" formula for at least 50 years.翻译:香港于 1997 年从英国统治下回归中国，并保证其自由将在“一国两种制度”下受到至少 50 年的保护。

Reporting by Albee Zhang and Ryan Woo; Additional reporting by Ben Blanchard; Editing by Bernadette Baum翻译:Albee 张和 Ryan Woo 的报道；本·布兰查德 (Ben Blanchard) 的补充报道；伯纳黛特·鲍姆编辑

item.title: 阿根廷大选使中巴关系成为焦点
item.description:
Argentina could see a resetting of some global ties depending on the result of its run-off presidential election later this month - although the value of trade with partners like China and Brazil may outweigh any short-term political posturing.翻译:阿根廷可能会看到一些全球关系的重置，具体取决于本月晚些时候第二轮总统选举的结果，尽管与中国和巴西等合作伙伴的贸易价值可能超过任何短期政治姿态。

While Economy Minister Sergio Massa, a pragmatist in the ruling left-leaning coalition, has signaled policy continuity, radical libertarian candidate Javier Milei has sharply lambasted China, Brazil, the pope, South America's Mercosur trade bloc and the China-led BRICS group.翻译:尽管执政的左翼联盟中的实用主义者、经济部长塞尔吉奥·马萨表示政策连续性，但激进的自由主义候选人哈维尔·米莱却严厉斥责了中国、巴西、教皇、南美南方共同市场贸易集团和中国领导的金砖国家集团。

Massa and Milei will compete in a Nov. 19 head-to-head that looks likely to be a tight race, with angry voters deeply divided amid inflation running at nearly 140%, two-fifths of the population in poverty, sky-high interest rates and capital controls hurting the economy.翻译:马萨和米雷将于 11 月 19 日进行正面交锋，这场比赛看起来可能会是一场激烈的角逐，愤怒的选民在通货膨胀率接近 140%、五分之二的人口陷入贫困、利益极高的情况下存在严重分歧。利率和资本管制损害了经济。

The vote could impact the global positioning of Argentina, South America's No. 2 economy, which is a major grains exporter as well as a lithium and shale producer. But years of volatility have made some international investors wary and it is the top debtor to the International Monetary Fund (IMF).翻译:此次投票可能会影响南美第二大经济体阿根​​廷的全球地位，该国是主要谷物出口国以及锂和页岩油生产国。但多年的波动让一些国际投资者保持警惕，而且它是国际货币基金组织（IMF）的最大债务国。

Gustavo Martinez Pandiani, current Argentine ambassador to Switzerland and Massa's likely foreign minister, said a future Massa government would seek to improve the country's global partnerships.翻译:现任阿根廷驻瑞士大使、可能担任马萨外交部长的古斯塔沃·马丁内斯·潘迪亚尼表示，未来的马萨政府将寻求改善该国的全球伙伴关系。

"While some promise to cut ties with Brazil or China, we want more markets and more trading partners, not less," he said.翻译:“虽然一些人承诺切断与巴西或中国的关系，但我们希望有更多的市场和更多的贸易伙伴，而不是更少，”他说。

Milei has said he "won't make deals with communists" in China or Brazil, though he does back private trade. He has described climate change as a "lie of socialism" and said Argentine Pope Francis is "on the side of bloody dictatorships."翻译:米雷表示，他“不会与中国或巴西的共产党人做交易”，但他确实支持私人贸易。他将气候变化描述为“社会主义的谎言”，并表示阿根廷教皇弗朗西斯“站在血腥独裁者一边”。

Diana Mondino, Milei's likely foreign minister, said some of his statements had been blown out of context, and that in fact he would look "to reinsert Argentina into the world."翻译:米莱可能担任外交部长的戴安娜·蒙迪诺表示，他的一些言论已经断章取义，事实上他会寻求“让阿根廷重新融入世界”。

"Not only is there not a problem with Brazil, but we hope to be able to trade as much as possible with Brazil," said Mondino, adding that with China - a key trade partner, creditor and investor - Milei would simply stop opaque state-to-state deals.翻译:蒙迪诺表示：“不仅与巴西没有问题，而且我们希望能够与巴西进行尽可能多的贸易。”他补充说，与中国这个重要的贸易伙伴、债权人和投资者相比，米莱将简单地停止不透明的国家- 州交易。

That could include the country's $18 billion currency swap line with China, which has helped cash-strapped Argentina pay back its IMF debt. China is also a big investor in local lithium projects, hydro and nuclear.翻译:这可能包括该国与中国的 180 亿美元货币互换额度，该额度帮助现金短缺的阿根廷偿还了国际货币基金组织的债务。中国也是当地锂项目、水电和核电项目的重要投资者。

"What we are not going to do are secret contracts. Argentina, this government, in the last 20 years, has had multiple secret negotiations," she said. "That is not normal and it is what we have said we are not going to do."翻译:“我们不会做的是秘密合同。阿根廷政府在过去20年里进行了多次秘密谈判，”她说。 “这是不正常的，我们已经说过我们不会这样做。”

A current senior Foreign Ministry source, from the same Peronist coalition as Massa, predicted that Argentina's ties with Brazil and China would continue regardless of who won the election.翻译:一位与马萨同属庇隆主义联盟的现任外交部高级消息人士预测，无论谁赢得选举，阿根廷与巴西和中国的关系都将继续下去。

"Relations with China are going to go as they have until now with either of the two candidates. The intense trade that exists with them cannot be dissolved," the person said, asking not to be identified.翻译:这位不愿透露姓名的人士表示：“与中国的关系将像两位候选人中的任何一位一样，与中国的关系将继续发展。与他们之间存在的激烈贸易关系无法消除。”

"The same thing would happen with Brazil: bad personal relations do not affect trade."翻译:“同样的事情也会发生在巴西：糟糕的个人关系不会影响贸易。”

TRADE BLOCS: MERCOSUR AND BRICS翻译:贸易集团：南方共同市场和金砖国家

Massa and Milei have also clashed on Mercosur, the regional trade bloc led by Argentina and Brazil that has faced internal tension from other members who say it is not an effective trade mechanism for negotiating global deals.翻译:马萨和米莱还在南方共同市场问题上发生了冲突，南方共同市场是由阿根廷和巴西领导的区域贸易集团，该集团面临着其他成员的内部紧张局势，他们称这不是谈判全球协议的有效贸易机制。

The Peronists want to strengthen the bloc, while Milei has threatened to pull Argentina out of it.翻译:庇隆主义者希望加强欧盟，而米莱则威胁要让阿根廷退出欧盟。

Pandiani said member countries needed to "modernize Mercosur to make it more efficient," and added that a Massa government would consider it their "main platform" for global trade.翻译:潘迪亚尼表示，成员国需要“实现南方共同市场的现代化，以提高其效率”，并补充说，马萨政府将把它视为全球贸易的“主要平台”。

"Argentina has a very promising future, because it has what the world demands: proteins; traditional, green and transition energy; critical minerals such as lithium and copper; rare earths and qualified human resources," he said.翻译:他说：“阿根廷的未来非常有前途，因为它拥有世界所需要的东西：蛋白质；传统、绿色和转型能源；锂和铜等关键矿物；稀土和合格的人力资源。”

The current government has also pushed to have Argentina in the China-backed BRICS group of developing countries, which also includes India, Brazil, Russia and South Africa. Argentina was invited to join the group in August. Milei opposes joining.翻译:本届政府还推动阿根廷加入中国支持的金砖国家集团，该集团还包括印度、巴西、俄罗斯和南非。阿根廷于八月受邀加入该小组。米莱反对加入。

"The BRICS are not a trading bloc. As of now it's not clear why we would want to have membership in this group," said Mondino. The BRICS are a relatively loosely-formed group with diverse political and geographical positions.翻译:“金砖五国不是一个贸易集团。目前还不清楚我们为什么希望成为这个集团的成员，”蒙迪诺说。金砖国家是一个结构相对松散的组织，具有不同的政治和地理位置。

Pandiani disagreed. "Rejecting entry into BRICS is nonsense; we believe that Argentina should always sit at the negotiating tables where important issues for our future are discussed," he said.翻译:潘迪亚尼不同意。 “拒绝加入金砖国家是无稽之谈；我们认为阿根廷应该始终坐在谈判桌上，讨论我们未来的重要问题，”他说。

Reporting by Lucila Sigal; Additional reporting by Nicolás Misculin; Editing by Adam Jourdan and Rosalba O'Brien翻译:卢西拉·西格尔报道；尼古拉斯·米斯库林 (Nicolás Misculin) 的补充报道；亚当·乔丹和罗莎尔巴·奥布莱恩编辑

item.title: 南航将兑现因故障而售出的 1.30 美元机票
item.description:
Chinese carrier China Southern Airlines (600029.SS) said on Thursday it would honor the sale of tickets priced as cheaply as $1.30 during a two-hour technical glitch on its mobile phone app and some ticket-booking platforms late on Wednesday.翻译:中国南方航空（600029.SS）周四表示，周三晚间其手机应用程序和一些订票平台出现了两小时的技术故障，该公司将接受低价至 1.30 美元的机票销售。

Consumers began reporting on Chinese social media at around 8 p.m. (1200 GMT) on Wednesday that many flights to and from the southwest metropolis of Chengdu were available at 10, 20 or 30 yuan ($1.37-$4.12) on China Southern's app. One screenshot circulating online showed a ticket from Chengdu to Beijing priced at only 10 yuan, compared to the normal minimum price of 400 to 500 yuan. Other online screenshots indicated the cheap prices were offered for about two hours on the carrier's app as well as across several ticket-booking platforms, including market leader Trip.com.翻译:周三晚上 8 点左右（格林威治标准时间 1200 点），消费者开始在中国社交媒体上报道称，在南航应用程序上，许多往返西南大都市成都的航班票价为 10 元、20 元或 30 元（1.37 美元至 4.12 美元）。网上流传的一张截图显示，从成都到北京的机票价格仅为10元，而正常最低票价为400至500元。其他在线屏幕截图显示，该航空公司的应用程序以及包括市场领导者 Trip.com 在内的多个机票预订平台都提供了大约两个小时的便宜价格。

On top of that price, buyers were required to pay at least an additional 110 yuan in airport fees and fuel surcharges. "Passengers can use them as normal," Guangzhou-based China Southern said, on the proviso that tickets were already paid for and issued.翻译:除此之外，买家还需额外支付至少110元的机场费和燃油附加费。总部位于广州的南航表示，“乘客可以正常使用它们”，但前提是机票已经付款并出票。

($1 = 7.2852 Chinese yuan renminbi)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.2852 人民币）

item.title: 英伟达计划向中国发布三款新芯片 - 当地媒体
item.description:
Nvidia (NVDA.O) is planning to release three new chips for China, local media reported on Thursday, weeks after the U.S. blocked it from selling two high-end artificial intelligence (AI) chips and one of its top gaming chips to Chinese firms.翻译:据当地媒体周四报道，英伟达(NVDA.O)计划向中国发布三款新芯片，几周前美国禁止该公司向中国公司出售两款高端人工智能 (AI) 芯片和一款顶级游戏芯片。 。

The STAR Market Daily news outlet, citing people familiar with the matter, said that the chips are called the HGX H20, L20 PCIe and L2 PCIe and that Nvidia could announce them on Nov. 16 at the earliest.翻译:STAR Market Daily 新闻媒体援引知情人士的话称，这些芯片被称为 HGX H20、L20 PCIe 和 L2 PCIe，Nvidia 最早可能会在 11 月 16 日发布。

Nvidia declined to comment when asked about the report.翻译:当被问及该报告时，英伟达拒绝置评。

Last month, the U.S. AI chip giant said new export restrictions announced by Washington would block it from selling two of its modified advanced AI chips - the A800 and H800 - both of which were created for the Chinese market last year to comply with previous export rules.翻译:上个月，这家美国人工智能芯片巨头表示，华盛顿宣布的新出口限制将阻止其销售两款经过修改的先进人工智能芯片——A800和H800——这两款芯片都是去年为中国市场创建的，以遵守之前的出口规则。

One of the company's top-of-the-line gaming chips, the L40S chip, which it announced in August, would also be affected, it said.翻译:该公司表示，该公司的顶级游戏芯片之一 L40S 芯片（8 月推出）也将受到影响。

On Oct. 24, Nvidia said those curbs would take immediate effect, as U.S. regulators had sped up an original deadline.翻译:10 月 24 日，英伟达表示，这些限制措施将立即生效，因为美国监管机构已经加快了原定的最后期限。

Nvidia has commanded more than 90% share of China's $7 billion AI chip market, and analysts have said the U.S. curbs are likely to create opportunities for domestic firms such as Huawei Technologies (HWT.UL) to make inroads.翻译:英伟达占据了中国 70 亿美元人工智能芯片市场 90% 以上的份额，分析师表示，美国的限制措施可能会为华为技术有限公司 (HWT.UL) 等国内公司创造进入市场的机会。

Chinese internet giant Baidu (9888.HK) placed a sizeable order for Huawei AI chips this year, sources have said. One said Baidu had done so before the U.S. curbs were announced as it was preparing for a future when it would no longer be able to purchase from Nvidia.翻译:消息人士称，中国互联网巨头百度（9888.HK）今年向华为人工智能芯片下了相当大的订单。一位人士表示，百度在美国宣布限制措施之前就已经这样做了，因为它正在为未来不再能够从英伟达购买产品做准备。

Reporting by Brenda Goh; Editing by Christopher Cushing and Edwina Gibbs翻译:布伦达·吴报道；克里斯托弗·库欣和埃德温娜·吉布斯编辑

item.title: 中国11月新增人民币贷款回落，政策支持到位 - 路透调查
item.description:
Summary:
  • Oct new loans seen at 665 bln yuan vs 2.31 trln yuan in Sept
  • Oct money supply growth seen at 10.3% y/y vs 10.3% in Sept
  • Oct TSF seen at 1.90 trln yuan vs 4.12 trln yuan in Sept
  • Loans, money supply data due Nov 10-15
翻译:概括：
  • 10 月新增贷款 6,650 亿元人民币，9 月新增贷款 23.1 万亿元
  • 10 月份货币供应量同比增长 10.3%，9 月份为 10.3%
  • 10 月 TSF 为 1.90 里拉人民币，9 月为 4.12 里拉人民币
  • 贷款、货币供应数据将于 11 月 10 日至 15 日到期

China's new yuan loans are expected to dip in October from the previous month because of seasonal factors, a Reuters poll showed, but the expected lending may exceed the year-earlier amount as the central bank sought to spur economic growth.翻译:路透调查显示，受季节性因素影响，中国10月份新增人民币贷款预计将环比下降，但由于央行寻求刺激经济增长，预计贷款额可能会超过去年同期。

Chinese banks are estimated to have issued 665 billion yuan ($91.29 billion) in net new yuan loans last month, less than a third of the 2.31 trillion yuan in September, according to the median estimate in the survey of 26 economists.翻译:根据对 26 名经济学家的调查的中值估计，上个月中国的银行估计发放了 6650 亿元人民币（合 912.9 亿美元）的新人民币贷款净额，不到 9 月份 2.31 万亿元人民币的三分之一。

But the expected tally would be still higher than the 615.2 billion yuan issued in the same month a year earlier.翻译:但预计发行总额仍高于去年同期发行的6152亿元人民币。

"October has always been a low season for new credit, and this year should be no exception," analysts at Citi said in a note.翻译:花旗分析师在一份报告中表示：“十月一直是新增信贷的淡季，今年也不例外。”

"Mortgage repricing effective at end-September could ease household early repayment pressures. Corporate borrowing could enjoy some support from improving profitability and bottoming exports, but we don't expect a buoyant number either."翻译:“9月底生效的抵押贷款重新定价可以缓解家庭提前还款的压力。企业借贷可能会因盈利能力提高和出口触底而得到一些支持，但我们预计数字也不会强劲。”

Beijing has been ramping up measures to support the economy, including 1 trillion yuan ($137.43 billion) in sovereign bond issuances and allowing local governments to frontload part of their 2024 bond quotas.翻译:北京一直在加大支持经济的措施，包括发行1万亿元人民币（1374.3亿美元）的主权债券，并允许地方政府提前加载2024年的部分债券配额。

But a property crisis, local debt risks and policy divergences with the West are all complicating the recovery process, highlighted by persistent deflationary pressures.翻译:但房地产危机、地方债务风险以及与西方的政策分歧都使复苏进程复杂化，持续的通货紧缩压力凸显了这一点。

The People's Bank of China (PBOC), which has delivered modest interest rate cuts and pumped out more cash into the economy in recent months, has pledged to keep policy supports.翻译:近几个月来，中国人民银行（PBOC）小幅降息并向经济注入更多现金，并承诺维持政策支持。

In September, the PBOC cut banks' reserve requirement ratio for the second time this year, and analysts expect another cut in the coming weeks.翻译:9月，中国人民银行今年第二次下调银行存款准备金率，分析师预计未来几周将再次下调。

China is expected to hit its annual growth target this year, and the country must transform its growth model to pursue high-quality and sustainable expansion, PBOC Governor Pan Gongsheng said on Wednesday.翻译:中国人民银行行长潘功胜周三表示，中国今年预计将实现全年增长目标，中国必须转变增长方式，实现高质量、可持续增长。

Outstanding yuan loans were expected to increase in October by 10.9% from a year earlier, the same as in September, the poll showed. Broad M2 money supply growth in October was seen at 10.3%, unchanged from September.翻译:调查显示，10月份人民币贷款余额预计同比增长10.9%，与9月份持平。 10 月份广义 M2 货币供应量增速为 10.3%，与 9 月份持平。

Local governments are allowed to issue 3.8 trillion yuan in special bonds this year to fund infrastructure projects to bolster the economy.翻译:今年允许地方政府发行3.8万亿元专项债券，为基础设施项目提供资金以提振经济。

Any acceleration in government bond issuance could help boost total social financing (TSF), a broad measure of credit and liquidity. Outstanding TSF was 9.0% higher at the end-September than a year earlier, the same as seen at end-August.翻译:政府债券发行的任何加速都可能有助于提高社会融资总额（TSF），这是衡量信贷和流动性的广泛指标。 9 月底未偿社会融资规模较去年同期增长 9.0%，与 8 月底相同。

In October, TSF is expected to fall to 1.9 trillion yuan from 4.12 trillion yuan in September, the poll showed.翻译:调查显示，10月份社会融资规模预计将从9月份的4.12万亿元降至1.9万亿元。

($1 = 7.2841 Chinese yuan renminbi)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.2841 人民币）

Reporting by Judy Hua and Kevin Yao; Editing by Christian Schmollinger翻译:Judy Hua 和 Kevin Yao 报道；克里斯蒂安·施莫林格编辑

item.title: 中国卫生部门认为反腐运动带来了更好的情绪——高管们
item.description:
Business activities in China's healthcare sector are returning from a sudden near freeze that began in July when Beijing kicked off a year-long anti-corruption campaign, two foreign industry executives said.翻译:两位外国行业高管表示，中国医疗保健行业的商业活动正在从七月份北京启动为期一年的反腐败运动时开始的突然近乎冻结中恢复过来。

The campaign targets the bribing of doctors in drug and medical equipment sales and marks a sharp escalation of an anti-corruption drive in the sector that started years ago. The latest campaign has sent a chill through the sector, pummeling healthcare stocks and prompting some firms to cancel IPOs.翻译:该行动的目标是在药品和医疗设备销售中贿赂医生，标志着多年前开始的该行业反腐败运动的急剧升级。最新的行动给整个行业带来了寒意，医疗保健股遭受重创，并促使一些公司取消首次公开募股。

"We see a recovery in terms of engagements ... we see an improvement in that area," Zafer Unluer, China president of U.S. healthcare company Organon (OGN.N), told Reuters on the sidelines of an industry event in Shanghai.翻译:美国医疗保健公司 Organon (OGN.N)中国区总裁 Zafer Unluer 在上海举行的一次行业活动间隙对路透表示：“我们看到参与度有所回升……我们看到该领域有所改善。”

"It is still as not high as before, but we see a bit of a balancing act."翻译:“它仍然不像以前那么高，但我们看到了一些平衡行为。”

The anti-graft drive initially caused huge business disruptions and many multinational pharmaceutical firms lost engagement with hospitals, executives said.翻译:高管们表示，反腐运动最初造成了巨大的业务中断，许多跨国制药公司失去了与医院的合作。

"We’ve seen some disruption in the ability of our medical representatives to visit hospitals, in our ability to implement some medical application activities," Larry Merizalde, China CEO of South African drugmaker Aspen (APNJ.J), told Reuters.翻译:南非制药商阿斯彭（APNJ.J）中国区首席执行官拉里·梅里扎德（Larry Merizalde）对路透社表示：“我们发现我们的医疗代表访问医院的能力以及实施一些医疗应用活动的能力受到了一些干扰。”

AstraZeneca (AZN.L), the largest foreign drugmaker in China, said on Thursday sales in China grew just 1% in the third quarter, partly impacted by "reduced promotional activities following the government campaign announced at the end of July".翻译:中国最大的外国制药商阿斯利康(AZN.L)周四表示，第三季度在华销售额仅增长 1%，部分原因是“7 月底宣布的政府行动后促销活动减少”。

The two executives said the overall mood, however, had improved over the past two months following communications such as a National Health Commission Q&A and a presentation from a government official.翻译:不过，两位高管表示，在国家卫生健康委员会的问答和政府官员的演讲等沟通之后，过去两个月的整体情绪有所改善。

"Over the last month, since the latest announcements from the government to clarify the objectives of this anti-corruption policy, we see that overall activities are coming back to normal," Merizalde said.翻译:梅里扎德说：“上个月，自从政府最新宣布澄清反腐败政策的目标以来，我们看到整体活动正在恢复正常。”

China is one of the biggest healthcare markets for global healthcare companies but their business sentiment has turned fragile this year due to factors including the anti-graft drive.翻译:中国是全球医疗保健公司最大的医疗保健市场之一，但由于反腐等因素，今年他们的商业信心变得脆弱。

Reporting by Andrew Silver; Editing by Miyoung Kim, Robert Birsel翻译:安德鲁·西尔弗报道；编辑：Miyoung Kim、Robert Birsel
item.author: Andrew Silver

item.title: 农化集团先正达表示明年可能进行 100 亿美元的 IPO
item.description:
Swiss agrochemicals company Syngenta said on Thursday it was still planning to complete its $10 billion flotation, but indicated weak financial markets made it more likely it will take place next year.翻译:瑞士农化公司先正达周四表示，仍计划完成其 100 亿美元的上市，但表示疲软的金融市场使其更有可能在明年进行。

The Chinese-owned company said it was also exploring "alternative methods" to expand its shareholder base as the seeds and pesticides maker seeks to raise cash to fund organic growth and pay down debt.翻译:这家中资公司表示，该公司还在探索“替代方法”来扩大股东基础，因为这家种子和农药制造商寻求筹集现金，为有机增长提供资金并偿还债务。

"Given weak market conditions we expect that the company will IPO by the end of next year," a company spokesman said on Thursday after Syngenta reported its Q3 earnings.翻译:“鉴于市场状况疲弱，我们预计该公司将在明年底前首次公开募股，”公司发言人周四在先正达公布第三季度收益后表示。

"We will also remain flexible in our approach and explore alternative methods to expanding our shareholder base," he said.翻译:他表示：“我们还将保持灵活的做法，并探索扩大股东基础的替代方法。”

The IPO update came as Syngenta, which competes with U.S. company Corteva (CTVA.N) and German firms BASF (BASFn.DE) and Bayer (BAYGn.DE), reported its latest earnings.翻译:此次 IPO 更新发布之际，先正达 (Syngenta) 公布了最新财报，该公司的竞争对手包括美国公司 Corteva (CTVA.N) 、德国公司巴斯夫(BASFn.DE)和拜耳(BAYGn.DE) 。

Sales in the three months to the end of September fell 13% to $6.8 billion, while earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation plunged 68% to $300 million.翻译:截至 9 月底的三个月销售额下降 13% 至 68 亿美元，而息税折旧摊销前利润下降 68% 至 3 亿美元。

Earnings were hit by weak demand in Brazil, one of Syngenta's biggest markets, where it also wrote down the value of part of its inventory.翻译:先正达最大市场之一巴西的需求疲软打击了盈利，该公司还减记了部分库存的价值。

The IPO remained the favoured option, the spokesman said, declining to comment on possible alternatives such as a private placement of shares.翻译:该发言人表示，首次公开募股仍然是最受欢迎的选择，但拒绝就私募股权等可能的替代方案发表评论。

Syngenta, which recently announced a change of chief executive and chief financial officer, has been pursuing an IPO for nearly two and half years.翻译:先正达最近宣布更换首席执行官和首席财务官，近两年半以来一直在寻求IPO。

Its application passed a review by the listing committee of the Shanghai Stock Exchange in June, but still needs approval from China's securities regulator.翻译:其申请于6月通过了上海证券交易所上市委员会的审核，但仍需中国证券监管机构的批准。

Syngenta was bought by ChemChina in 2017 for $43 billion and folded it into Sinochem Holdings Corp in 2021.翻译:先正达于2017年被中国化工以430亿美元收购，并于2021年并入中化控股公司。

The Chinese parent is pursuing a flotation that is expected to give the company an enterprise value of about $60 billion.翻译:这家中国母公司正在寻求上市，预计将使该公司的企业价值达到约 600 亿美元。

Sinochem is expected to keep a majority stake in the business, with cash raised going towards funding organic growth, research and development, and acquisitions.翻译:预计中化集团将保留该业务的多数股权，筹集的现金将用于资助有机增长、研发和收购。

item.title: 小米新机销量强劲，中国智能手机市场回暖
item.description:
Xiaomi's (1810.HK) sales of more than 1 million units of its latest flagship smartphone in the week since its launch are a fresh sign that a slump in China's phone market could be nearing an end, analysts said.翻译:分析师表示，小米（1810.HK）最新旗舰智能手机自推出以来一周内销量超过 100 万部，这是中国手机市场低迷可能即将结束的新迹象。

Demand in the world's biggest smartphone market has long been in decline, with the COVID-19 pandemic and then a faltering economic recovery persuading customers to wait longer before upgrading their phones.翻译:全球最大智能手机市场的需求长期以来一直在下降，原因是新冠肺炎 (COVID-19) 疫情以及随后的经济复苏步履蹒跚，迫使客户在升级手机之前等待更长时间。

"Sales of the Mi 14 series have exceeded 1 million units and the phones are still in severe short supply," Xiaomi Chief Executive Lei Jun wrote on the microblogging platform Weibo this week.翻译:小米首席执行官雷军本周在微博平台上写道：“小米14系列销量已突破100万台，但手机仍严重供不应求。”

The model went on sale in China on Oct. 31. It uses Qualcomm's cutting-edge Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 processor and Xiaomi's proprietary HyperOS software.翻译:该机型于10月31日在中国上市。它采用高通尖端的Snapdragon 8 Gen 3处理器和小米专有的HyperOS软件。

The robust launch "reinforces signs of the market bottoming out," said Will Wong, an analyst with industry research firm IDC.翻译:行业研究公司 IDC 的分析师 Will Wong 表示，此次强劲的推出“强化了市场触底的迹象”。

It comes on the heels of a big jump in sales for Huawei (HWT.UL) as shoppers snapped up its Mate 60 series phones - a comeback for the company after the U.S. imposed export controls on it in 2019.翻译:此前，随着消费者抢购华为 Mate 60 系列手机，华为 (HWT.UL) 的销量大幅增长，这是该公司在 2019 年美国对其实施出口管制后卷土重来。

IDC predicts the Chinese market is on track to achieve year-on-year sales growth in the fourth quarter after ten consecutive quarters of decline. It did not specify the level of growth.翻译:IDC预计，中国市场在连续十个季度下滑后，第四季度有望实现销售额同比增长。它没有具体说明增长水平。

U.S. chip designer Qualcomm also said last week that it is seeing strong demand from smartphone companies, especially in China.翻译:美国芯片设计商高通公司上周也表示，它看到智能手机公司的强劲需求，尤其是在中国。

The Mi 14 series, priced between 3,999 yuan and 6,499 yuan ($550-$890), represents an attempt by Xiaomi to make deeper inroads into the premium smartphone market and compete with Apple (AAPL.O) and Huawei.翻译:Mi 14系列的售价在3,999元至6,499元（550-890美元）之间，代表着小米进一步进军高端智能手机市场并与苹果（AAPL.O）和华为竞争的尝试。

($1 = 7.2856 Chinese yuan)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.2856 人民币）

item.title: 随着复苏的摇摆不定，中国的消费者价格再次下降
item.description:
Summary:
  • Oct CPI -0.2% y/y vs 0.0% in Sep
  • Oct CPI -0.1% m/m vs +0.2% in Sep
  • Oct PPI -2.6% y/y vs -2.5% in Sep
翻译:概括：
  • 10 月 CPI 同比为 -0.2%，9 月为 0.0%
  • 10 月 CPI 环比为 -0.1%，9 月为 +0.2%
  • 10 月 PPI 同比为 -2.6%，9 月为 -2.5%

China's consumer prices swung lower in October, as key gauges of domestic demand pointed to weakness not seen since the pandemic, while factory-gate deflation deepened, casting doubts over the chances of a broad-based economic recovery.翻译:中国十月份的消费者价格下跌，因为国内需求的关键指标显示出自大流行以来未见的疲软，而工厂门口的通货紧缩加剧，使人们对广泛的经济复苏的机会产生了怀疑。

The consumer price index (CPI) dropped 0.2% in October from a year earlier and slipped 0.1% from September, data from the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) showed on Thursday.翻译:国家统计局周四公布的数据显示，10月份居民消费价格指数（CPI）同比下降0.2%，环比下降0.1%。

The declines undershot the median 0.1% year-on-year fall and flat month-on-month reading predicted in a Reuters poll. Both indicators were last negative at the same time in November 2020 during the COVID-19 pandemic.翻译:跌幅低于路透调查预测的同比跌幅中值 0.1% 和环比持平。这两项指标最后一次同时为负数是在 2020 年 11 月 COVID-19 大流行期间。

The headline figure was dragged by a further slump in pork prices, down 30.1%, speeding up from a 22% slide in September, amid an oversupply of pigs and weak demand.翻译:总体数据受到猪肉价格进一步下跌的拖累，在生猪供应过剩和需求疲软的情况下，猪肉价格下跌 30.1%，较 9 月份的 22% 降幅有所加快。

However, even core inflation, which excludes food and fuel prices, slowed to 0.6% in October from 0.8% in September, pointing to China's continued battle with disinflationary forces and the risk of again missing the government's full-year headline inflation target, set at around 3%.翻译:然而，即使是不包括食品和燃料价格的核心通胀率，也从 9 月的 0.8% 放缓至 10 月的 0.6%，这表明中国仍在继续与通货紧缩力量作斗争，并且有再次达不到政府设定的全年总体通胀目标的风险。 3%左右。

Consumer prices slipped into deflation in July and returned to positive territory in August but were flat in September. Factory deflation persisted for the 13th straight month in October.翻译:消费者价格在 7 月份陷入通货紧缩，并在 8 月份恢复正值，但 9 月份持平。 10 月份工厂通货紧缩已连续第 13 个月持续。

Combined with other economic indicators, the data in the fourth-quarter so far suggests a meaningful recovery in the world's second-largest economy remains elusive.翻译:结合其他经济指标，第四季度迄今为止的数据表明，世界第二大经济体的有意义的复苏仍然难以实现。

"The data shows combating persistent disinflation amid weak demand remains a challenge for Chinese policymakers," said Bruce Pang, chief economist at Jones Lang Lasalle.翻译:仲量联行首席经济学家布鲁斯·庞表示：“数据显示，在需求疲软的情况下应对持续的通货紧缩仍然是中国政策制定者面临的挑战。”

"An appropriate policy mix and more supportive measures are needed to prevent the economy from a downward drift in inflation expectations that could threaten business confidence and household spending."翻译:“需要采取适当的政策组合和更多的支持性措施，以防止经济出现通胀预期下滑，从而威胁企业信心和家庭支出。”

Month-on-month, CPI fell 0.1%, compared with a 0.2% gain in September.翻译:环比来看，CPI下降0.1%，而9月份上涨0.2%。

The producer price index (PPI) fell 2.6% year-on-year against a 2.5% drop in September. Economists had predicted a 2.7% fall in October.翻译:生产者出厂价格指数（PPI）同比下降2.6%，9月份为下降2.5%。经济学家此前预测 10 月份将下降 2.7%。

Authorities have repeatedly downplayed the risks.翻译:当局一再淡化这些风险。

"There is no deflation in China and there will be no deflation in the future," said a statistics bureau official in August.翻译:“中国不存在通缩，未来也不会出现通货紧缩，”国家统计局官员8月份表示。

Beijing has been ramping up measures to support the broader economy, including 1 trillion yuan ($137.43 billion) in sovereign bond issuance and a move to allow local governments to frontload part of their 2024 bond quotas.翻译:北京一直在加大力度支持更广泛的经济，包括发行1万亿元人民币（1,374.3亿美元）的主权债券，以及允许地方政府预付部分2024年债券配额。

But a property crisis, local debt risks and policy divergence with the West all complicate the recovery process.翻译:但房地产危机、地方债务风险以及与西方的政策分歧都使复苏进程变得复杂。

Recent indicators of the economy have been mixed.翻译:最近的经济指标好坏参半。

China's imports unexpectedly grew in October while exports contracted at a quicker pace. Meanwhile, the official purchasing managers' index showed factory activity unexpectedly contracting and services activity slowing last month.翻译:10月份中国进口意外增长，而出口则加速收缩。与此同时， 官方采购经理人指数显示上个月工厂活动意外收缩，服务业活动放缓。

China also recorded its first-ever quarterly deficit in foreign direct investment (FDI), underlining capital outflow pressure following Western governments' "de-risking" moves.翻译:中国还首次出现外国直接投资（FDI） 季度赤字，凸显了西方政府“去风险”举措后的资本外流压力。

"We expect China's economy to grow by 5.0% in 2023, in accordance with the target set by authorities, followed by 4.0% growth in 2024 and 2025," said Moody's on Thursday.翻译:穆迪周四表示：“根据当局设定的目标，我们预计中国经济将在 2023 年增长 5.0%，随后在 2024 年和 2025 年增长 4.0%。”

"However, we see downside risks to China's trend growth on account of structural factors."翻译:“然而，由于结构性因素，我们认为中国的趋势增长存在下行风险。”

Reporting Liangping Gao, Ella Cao and Ryan Woo; Editing by Sam Holmes翻译:报道高亮平、Ella Cao 和 Ryan Woo；山姆·霍姆斯编辑
